snippet: Talha Asmal, a student from West Yorkshire, would be his country’s youngest known suicide bomber if his role in an attack in Iraq is confirmed.
abstract: Family members of Talha Asmal, 17-year-old from West Yorkshire, Britain, identify him in photo posted on social media by Islamic State militants claiming his participation in group's suicide bombing at Iraqi security facility, which killed at least 10 people; parents blame son's radicalization on Internet and social media.

byline.contributor: Omar Al-Jawoshy contributed reporting from Baghdad, and Tim Arango from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: Talha Asmal, a student from West Yorkshire, would be his country’s youngest known suicide bomber if his role in an attack in Iraq is confirmed.

headline.main: Tracing a 17-Year-Old’s Path From Britain to an ISIS Suicide Attack
headline.print_headline: A Young Man’s Path to ISIS Suicide Attack

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
